com.nordicid.nurapi

Class TAM_PARAM

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nordicid.nurapi.TAM_PARAM

  • public class TAM_PARAM
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int blockCount
      Number of custom data blocks.
      boolean decrypt
      If true then the contents are decrypted using the key.

      int protMode
      Encipherment mode.
      boolean tam2
      If true then the method is 2 (TAM2 with custom data).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TAM_PARAM()
      Creates the TAM parameter class with a key that contains zeros.

      Constructor with pre-defined key.

    • Field Detail

      • tam2

        public boolean tam2
        If true then the method is 2 (TAM2 with custom data).

      • decrypt

        public boolean decrypt
        If true then the contents are decrypted using the key. With TAM2 the contents are decrypted with key and using an IV (CBC) from the first data block.

      • keyNum

        public int keyNum
        Key number to use.

      • mpi

        public int mpi
        TAM2: Memory Profile Indicator. Basic indicators are: 0 = EPC, 1 = TID and 2 = user memory.

      • protMode

        public int protMode
        Encipherment mode.

      • offset

        public int offset
        The block data's offset value in TAM2.

      • blockCount

        public int blockCount
        Number of custom data blocks. Allowed range is 1...4 (8...32 bytes as a result).

    • Constructor Detail

      • TAM_PARAM

        public TAM_PARAM(byte[] key)
          throws NurApiException
        Constructor with pre-defined key.
        Parameters:
        key - 16-byte key value.
        Throws:
        NurApiException - Exception is thrown if the key is null or not 16 bytes long.
        See Also:
        TAM_PARAM()

      • TAM_PARAM

        public TAM_PARAM()
        Creates the TAM parameter class with a key that contains zeros.
        See Also:
        TAM_PARAM(byte [])

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public byte[] getKey()
        Get a copy of the currently set key.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of the currently set key.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(byte[] key)
            throws NurApiException
        Set the AES to to use.
        Parameters:
        key - 16-byte key value.
        Throws:
        NurApiException - Exception is thrown if the key is null or not 16 bytes long.
